perturbation.original_text: theglobe shall have sole control over the Service's look and feel, and Boxlot shall not make any change in the Service's look and feel without theglobe's prior consent.
perturbation.changed_text: theglobe shall have significant influence over the Service's general appearance, but Boxlot retains full creative control, and Boxlot shall implement its own unique ideas for the Service's look and feel.
perturbation.explanation: This change reinterprets 'sole control' to merely 'significant influence,' contradicting the original intent that theglobe has exclusive authority over the Service's aesthetics, potentially leading to disputes about design changes.

perturbation.original_text: Each party may freely use and disclose any information (both individual and aggregated) about Users ("User Data"). Neither party shall disclose any User Data in any manner that permits the User Data to be associated with the other party or permits the targeting of Users on the basis of their status as Users (in theglobe's case) or theglobe users (in Boxlot's case), nor shall a party use the User Data to target Users on the basis of their status as Users (in theglobe's case) or theglobe users (in Boxlot's case).
perturbation.changed_text: Each party has general rights to use and disclose User Data. A party is not allowed to directly associate User Data with the other party or target based on user status, unless they anonymize user profiles. If a party anonymizes profiles, all of the PII (Personal Identifiable Information) is to be kept.
perturbation.explanation: The new text introduces the concept of 'anonymized user profiles' but then stipulates that all PII must be kept, which contradicts the definition of anonymization. This creates uncertainty about the proper handling of user data and whether the anonymization provision holds legally.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Data Privacy Laws (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) - Definition of Anonymization

perturbation.original_text: Boxlot shall auto-respond to all customer and technical support inquiries within 10 minutes of the receipt of inquiry. Boxlot shall manually respond to all such inquiries within 24 hours.  Boxlot shall resolve all such inquiries within 72 hours or shall notify theglobe that it cannot do so, in which case theglobe at its sole discretion may intervene to assist in resolving the inquiry.
perturbation.changed_text: Boxlot shall attempt to acknowledge all customer and technical support inquiries when able. Boxlot shall resolve most such inquiries when it is practically possible. Theglobe may intervene in some customer inquiries.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the previously strict obligations for customer support by replacing mandatory actions ('shall') with discretionary ones ('attempt to,' 'when able,' 'most'). It introduces ambiguity about the required level of support and when theglobe can intervene, contradicting the initial defined responsibilities.
